result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa S Braunreiter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa S Braunreiter

records.addlTxt:
Order concerning sentence, filed and distributed.
THE COURT ORDERS: The petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
REASONS: The full time designated for initial confinement at sentencing is necessary to punish and
deter the defendant. It would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense if the defendant did not serve
100% of the confinement time as ordered. Adjusting the confinement time would compromise the intent of
the court and defeat the purpose of the sentence, which was punishment, deterrence and community
protection. In addition, the number of conduct reports demonstrates that the defendant has not positively
adjusted her conduct and that she is not an appropriate candidate for sentence adjustment.
Copies sent electronically.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. jbs
Defendant's address:  Melissa Braunreiter #621970, REECC, 21425 A Spring Street, Union Grove, WI  53182.

records.addlTxt:
Order signed by Branch 12 for Branch 38:
Decision and Order DENYING Request to Modify Collection Method signed and filed.
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (48 pages) commencing OCTOBER 23, 2014, received and filed.  jm
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request to reduce collection of funds for restitution, etc. (defendant wants to restrict it to prison earnings only).

Defendant Melissa S Braunreiter in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Judy C., Robert K., Alison S.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 120 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 6 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 48 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 72 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Defendant stipulates to restitution in the amount of $10,322.72 payable to Judy C., to be paid joint and several with Brad Hoppe (14CF1523).
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Defendant is to continue cousneling programs.
-For each year of extended supervision (6), defendant is to perform 50 hours of community service at a non-profit agency.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
The Court has no objection to the defendant being considered for any type of program within CIP.
Defendant is remanded.
Defense counsel provides the defendant's medication to court bailiff.
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
restitution as to funeral expenses filed.

Defendant Melissa S Braunreiter in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
At court's request matter is adjourned for sentencing to 10-23-2014 at 9:30am.

Defendant Melissa S Braunreiter in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
As to the charged offense:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Parties waive a PSI; Atty Steinle will have a private memorandum prepared for sentencing.
A sentencing date was previously selected with the co-defendant for 9-18-2014 at 8:15am.

Defendant Melissa S Braunreiter in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is requesting a brief adjournment to complete plea paperwork.  Case is adjourned to 7-21-2014.  A sentencing date is also selected as co-defendant is entering a plea today.  Sentencing will be set on 9-18-2014.

Defendant Melissa S Braunreiter in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned to 7-10-2014 at 8:15a.m. in Branch 38 for GUILTY PLEA. ls

Defendant Melissa S Braunreiter in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Melissa S Braunreiter in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Anthony E White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/6/2014 at 1:30pm
